verbose_text: Using endothelial CD146 specific knockout mice and the monoclonal anti-CD146 AA98 antibody, we found that selectively deleting CD146 expression in vascular endothelial cells or blocking endothelial CD146 with the AA98 antibody causes a significant reduction in the infiltration of pathogenic lymphocytes into the CNS, including CD4 +, CD8 +, CD146 +, T H 1 and T H 17 cells, thereby reducing the severity of MOG (35-55)-induced EAE without affecting lymphocyte activation or proliferation.
